thread.title: Football | Holloway's quick outs for long TDs lift Grassfield
thread.title_full: Football | Holloway's quick outs for long TDs lift Grassfield | HamptonRoads.com | PilotOnline.com

author: Lee Tolliver
title: Football | Holloway's quick outs for long TDs lift Grassfield
text:
SUFFOLK A football team gets a pretty good hint that things are going to go its way when the first play goes for a touchdown.
It doesn't hurt that the guy making that play is Grant Holloway.
Grassfield quarterback Justice Bigbie tossed a quick out about 20 yards to Holloway, who took off on a blazing sprint down the left sideline for a 65-yard score. It set the tone for the Grizzlies' 38-14 victory over King's Fork in a battle of top 10 teams Friday night.
The victory leaves ninth-ranked Grassfield (6-1) tied with Indian River for second place in the Southeastern.
"That opening play was huge," Grassfield coach Martin Asprey said.
It helped the Grizzlies that No. 7 King's Fork was without coach Joe Jones and running back Deshaun Wethington. Both were suspended for a game after being ejected in the fourth quarter last week against Lakeland.
Wethington had missed the season opener, but still has run for 983 yards and 11 touchdowns on 111 carries this season. He is the No. 2 all-time regular-season rusher in South Hampton Roads with 4,589 yards.
"He's a special running back," Asprey said. "But we knew his backup was pretty good, too."
Sophomore Darran Butts stepped in admirably for the Bulldogs, picking up 145 yards and a touchdown on 22 carries.
But Grassfield had simply too many weapons - led by Holloway, who scores about 30 percent of every time he touches the ball. Leading 14-7 near the end of the first quarter, Bigbie ran the same play, resulting in a 77-yard catch- and-run score for Holloway.
Holloway finished with 148 yards on five catches. He rushed once on an end-around for 16 yards that had King's Fork defensive coordinator Dave Waddell shaking his head and telling his assistants: "Man, that kid is fast."
Grassfield's quarterback also understands what an asset a player like Grant can be.
"We could probably give it to him every time. He's incredible," said Bigbie, who finished with 194 yards and two touchdowns on 10-of-21 passing with no interceptions. "Having a guy like him helps a ton."
But the Grizzlies were far from one-dimensional.
Shawndell Joyner and ShaJuan Goodman each finished with 72 yards and a touchdown.
Grassfield led 28-14 at halftime and held the Bulldogs (5-2) scoreless in the second half.
Lee Tolliver, 757-222-5844,
lee.tolliver@pilotonline.com
